t

of one thowsand five hundereth thirtie thre poundes and nyntyne shillinges wherof

s
for the intertaignement of a Companie of horse

ch
debt thought it hath ben often demaunded by his L: of the

Generall
and that aswell the
Quenes ma
tie
have wrighten earnestly heretofore that
considerac
o
n might be had of his L: demand
haveing borne the office of L:
generall of her ma
t
Forces, and given them and those Cunteries just occac
o
n by
his well deserving of that State that more speciall regard should be had of his
L: Neverthelesse these meanes as yet w
ch
his L: hath used, nor the mediac
o
n of
her ma
tie
& us could p
r

cure his L: that satisfacc
o
n w
ch

But Contrarilie his L: hath now of late, both given us to understand that Certaine
movables and good
of his owne are their detayned under arrest upon p
r
tence
of a
for the hier of a house w
ch
as his L: inforemeth us ought to be defrayed by the said
Estat
generall, and for these respect
hath made earenest suite unto us that
he might be
mitted to arrest & staye some good
belongeing to the subject
of
those
vinc
under the said Stat
, for the recovery of those somes w
ch
are due
unto his L: and the assuerance of his good
their detayned. Wherein we are
hetherto, loath to yeald that anie such Course should be taken that might breed
troubles to anie of the people of those
vinc
, But have Caused the deputies lately
sent hether from the states to understand his L: greifes and request, whoe have
mised to doe their best indeav
r
att their retorne to
cure his L: just satisfacc
o
n

t
: And where his L: hath one other suite w
ch

heretofore recomended to the said Stat
aswell by her ma

owne l
re
s as ours

of twoe thowsand pound
forfited to his L: by
martin
De Le Failla

Haunce Barnard
Concerninge the ransome of the said De La Failla
who was his L: prisoner. w
ch
suite as we are informed is now brought before the
said Stat
and their depending w
th

r

o
n of a noble man that hathe imploied himselfe to his great
deteriment for their good &
dete
borne that Chardge & goverment there, that
his L: maie not be occasioned to importune her ma
tie
& us uppon refusall, to do
him Justi
c
, to take those Cawses w
ch
they knowe Cannott but breed greate
inconvenien
c
, and yet in Justi
c
cannott be reasonably denied to his L: So
hopeing yo
u

cure that his L: may
have satisfacc
